course.subject: ELEC
course.name: Principles of Digital Communications
course.description: The aim of this course is to provide an in-depth treatment of the theoretical basis, analysis, and design of digital communication systems. The first half of the course will focus on the theoretical foundations of a basic digital communication system, including source coding, modulating and channel coding, and introductory information theory. The second half will deal with advanced techniques including orthogonal frequency division multiplexing (OFDM), multi-antenna communications, spread-spectrum communications, and cooperative communications.

reviews.author: hulu
reviews.comment_content: For a communication engineering student, the contents are very useful, including source coding, channel coding and advanced techniques such as OFDM.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. LETAIEF is very good. He is a big guy in this field. He can illustrate the concepts very clearly and he is very kind and willing to answer students' questions
reviews.comment_grading: I think it's fair and grades are between A+ ~ A-. It was decided by your homework, mid-term and final term exams, final project and presentations.
reviews.comment_workload: 3 assignments, but useful for studying; midterm exam; final-term exam; final project and presentation (not hard, can survey)

reviews.author: mzhnq
reviews.comment_content:
Content is comprehensive and covers a wide range of communication techniques, not too much for one course and not too little either.

The course content is not deep and easy to understand, but books are needed to be read on your own to do homework and presentations.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is excellent. Very clear and logical. Prof. Zhang is also very helpful in answering questions and very professional in this field. The course materials can be understood well in the lectures by his teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is fair. You can get A if you do reasonable well in homeworks, the presentation and the exam, by getting about 80 out of 100 for all of them.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is not heavy, but also not little. THe homeworks and presentation needs a good overall understandings of the wireless communications and many materials are not covered in the lectures, but in books. So there are lots of readings, but overall it is not too much real work to be done except studying by yourself.
